In the field of education, China saw an impressive increase in elementary and
middle school enrollment between 1949 and 1976, in both urban and rural areas.
Somescholarshave arguedthatruralenrollment atelementary andsecondary
level continued to expand even during the turbulent early 197os.This trend had
obvious benefits for the children of peasants, especially girls, whose education
had rarely been a priority in rural China prior to the founding of the PRC.
